author: jochembrouwer
content:
1/3 is a lot. I'm starting to become a strong fan of PAY, it is a hassle-free way of sending ether and also cheap because you also don't "waste" the 2300 gas on code if you are calling a code. The point for EOF forwarding all gas makes this even more prominent: then the "simple" challenge of paying people ether from a smart contract could become a big hassle and security concerns (although I stil believe that "re-entrancy locks" should not be necessary, contracts should be audited very good. But of course that still does not promise that there is no bug)

I am truly surprised by the 1/3. Maybe one contract is sending a zillion of tiny eth transfers? Or small payments in uniswap or something which would somewhat explain this?
